complaint_summary: Sohanra filed a pre-emption suit claiming superior rights over a piece of land measuring 36 kanals 11 marlas sold to Muhammad Aslam for Rs. 1000.
investigation_summary: The trial court examined evidence including oral testimony and a pedigree table (Ex.P.8) to establish the relationship between the vendor and the pre-emptor.
judgment_summary: The court affirmed the findings of the lower courts that Sohanra had superior pre-emption rights due to his kinship with the vendor, despite minor discrepancies in the name of the common ancestor.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal dismissed; findings of lower courts affirmed.
legal_arguments: Discrepancy between names 'Aziz Muhammad' and 'Abdul Aziz' in pedigree table.
Statutory presumption of truth for pedigree table.
Concurrent findings of lower courts cannot be re-appraised.

witness_statement.Maulvi Ahmad Bakhsh: Provided oral evidence corroborating the pedigree table.
witness_statement.Sohanra: Claimed kinship with vendor through common ancestor Abdul Aziz.

key_issues: Whether the pre-emptor had superior rights of pre-emption over the vendee.
Discrepancy in names of common ancestor in evidence.

maxims.Statutory Presumption: Pedigree table carries statutory presumption of truth.

legal_terms.Pre-emption: The right to purchase property before others.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around pre-emption rights claimed by Sohanra based on kinship with the vendor. Evidence included oral testimony and a pedigree table. Minor discrepancies in names did not affect the conclusion. Appeal dismissed; lower court findings upheld.

trial_court.decision: Pre-emption suit decreed in favor of Sohanra

appellate_court.basis: Vendor and pre-emptor related through common ancestor

current_court.basis: Variation in ancestor's name immaterial; findings affirmed

costs: Parties to bear their own costs
